alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 2:27PM CDT until April 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Extreme Fire Conditions Today... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EXTREME FIRE CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF EASTERN IOWA, NORTHWEST ILLINOIS AND NORTHEAST MISSOURI... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF EASTERN IOWA, NORTHWEST ILLINOIS AND NORTHEAST MISSOURI... The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a Red Flag Warning for critical fire conditions, which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM CDT Thursday. * TIMING...11 AM to 8 PM CDT. * WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 23 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 60s. * IMPACTS...Any fires will spread rapidly and be very difficult to control in these dangerous conditions. Outdoor burning should be avoided.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
